intro: Acourtia nudicaulis, commonly known as the naked stalked acourtia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a low, spreading growth habit. Its flowers are usually yellow or reddish, and it produces small, dry fruits called cypsela. Acourtia nudicaulis is often found in open areas such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
